availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abraham G. Smith (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Smith. Father of Nannie Smith and Abraham Smith. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 1, p. 247. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 48. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 14. Find A Grave, "Abraham Smith (April 3, 1791 - January 1, 1865)" Memorial #142448047, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142448047/abraham-smith (accessed March 23, 2018).
